==Events==
* [[456]] &ndash; [[Magister militum]] [[Ricimer]] defeats Emperor [[Avitus]] at [[Piacenza]] and becomes master of the [[Western Roman Empire]].
* [[690]] &ndash; Empress [[Wu Zetian]] ascends to the [[throne]] of the [[Tang Dynasty]] and proclaims herself ruler of the [[China|Chinese Empire]].
*[[1384]] &ndash; [[Jadwiga of Poland|Jadwiga]] is crowned [[List of Polish kings|King of Poland]], although she is a woman.
*[[1590]] &ndash; [[Carlo Gesualdo]], [[composer]], Prince of [[Venosa]] and [[Count of Conza]], murders his wife, Donna Maria d'Avalos, and her lover Fabrizio [[House of Carafa|Carafa]], the Duke of [[Andria, Italy|Andria]] at the Palazzo San Severo in [[Naples]].
*[[1780]] &ndash; [[Royalton, Vermont|Royalton]], Vermont and [[Tunbridge, Vermont|Tunbridge]], Vermont are the last major raids of the [[American Revolutionary War]].
*[[1781]] &ndash; [[George Washington]] captures [[Yorktown, Virginia|Yorktown]], Virginia after the [[Siege of Yorktown]].
*[[1793]] &ndash; [[Marie Antoinette]], widow of [[Louis XVI of France|Louis XVI]], is [[guillotine]]d at the height of the [[French Revolution]].
*  1793   &ndash; The [[Battle of Wattignies (1793)|Battle of Wattignies]] ends in a [[French First Republic|French]] victory.
*[[1813]] &ndash; The [[Sixth Coalition]] attacks [[Napoleon I of France|Napoleon Bonaparte]] in the [[Battle of Leipzig]].
*[[1814]] &ndash; [[London Beer Flood]] occurs in [[London]], killing eight.
*[[1834]] &ndash; Much of the ancient structure of the [[Palace of Westminster]] in London [[Burning of Parliament|burns to the ground]].
*[[1841]] &ndash; [[Queen's University, Canada|Queen's University]] is founded in [[Kingston, Ontario|Kingston]], Ontario, Canada.
*[[1843]] &ndash; Sir [[William Rowan Hamilton]] comes up with the idea of [[quaternion]]s, a [[commutativity|non-commutative]] extension of [[complex number]]s.
*[[1846]] &ndash; [[William T. G. Morton]] first demonstrated ether [[anesthesia]] at the [[Massachusetts General Hospital]] in the [[Ether Dome]].
*[[1859]] &ndash; [[John Brown (abolitionist)|John Brown]] [[John Brown's raid on Harpers Ferry|leads a raid]] on [[Harpers Ferry, West Virginia]].
*[[1869]] &ndash; The [[Cardiff Giant]], one of the most famous American [[hoax]]es, is "discovered".
*  1869   &ndash; [[Girton College, Cambridge]] is founded, becoming England's first residential college for women.
*[[1875]] &ndash; [[Brigham Young University]] is founded in [[Provo, Utah|Provo]], Utah.
*[[1882]] &ndash; The [[New York, Chicago and St. Louis Railroad|Nickel Plate Railroad]] opens for business.
*[[1905]] &ndash; The [[Partition of Bengal (1905)|Partition of Bengal]] in India takes place.
*[[1906]] &ndash; The [[Wilhelm Voigt|Captain of Köpenick]] fools the [[City hall (administration)|city hall]] of [[Köpenick]] and several soldiers by impersonating a [[Prussia]]n officer.
*[[1916]] &ndash; In Brooklyn, New York, [[Margaret Sanger]] opens the first [[family planning]] clinic in the United States.
*[[1923]] &ndash; [[The Walt Disney Company]] is founded by [[Walt Disney]] and his brother, [[Roy O. Disney|Roy Disney]].
*[[1934]] &ndash; Chinese [[Communism|Communists]] begin the [[Long March]]; it ended a year and four days later, by which time [[Mao Zedong]] had regained his title as party chairman.
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: First attack on British territory by the [[Nazi Germany|German]] [[Luftwaffe]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[The Holocaust|Holocaust]]: The [[Warsaw Ghetto]] is established.
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[Wally Walrus]], [[Woody Woodpecker|Woody Woodpecker's]] first steady foil, was debuted at the ''[[The Beach Nut]]'', a [[Walter Lantz Productions|Walter Lantz's]] cartoon.
*[[1945]] &ndash; The [[Food and Agriculture Organization]] is founded in [[Quebec City]], Canada.
*[[1946]] &ndash; [[Nuremberg Trials]]: Execution of the convicted [[Nazi]] leaders of the Main Trial.
*[[1949]] &ndash; [[Nikolaos Zachariadis]], leader of the [[Communist Party of Greece]], announces a "temporary cease-fire", effectively ending the [[Greek Civil War]].
*  1949   &ndash; The [[diplomatic relations]] between the [[Soviet Union]] and the [[German Democratic Republic]] are established.
*[[1951]] &ndash; The first [[Prime Minister of Pakistan]], [[Liaquat Ali Khan]], is [[assassination|assassin]]ated in [[Rawalpindi]].
*[[1962]] &ndash; The [[Cuban missile crisis]] between the United States, [[Cuba]], and the [[Soviet Union]] begins when US President [[John F. Kennedy]] is shown photographs of missile sites in Cuba.
*[[1964]] &ndash; China detonates its first [[596 (nuclear test)|nuclear weapon]].
*  1964   &ndash; Soviet leaders [[Leonid Brezhnev]] and [[Alexei Kosygin]] are inaugurated as [[General Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union|General Secretary of the CPSU]] and [[Premier of the Soviet Union|Premier]], respectively and the [[All-People's Government|collective leadership]] is established.
*[[1968]] &ndash; United States athletes [[Tommie Smith]] and [[John Carlos]] are kicked off the US team for participating in the [[1968 Olympics Black Power salute]].
*  1968   &ndash; [[Kingston, Jamaica|Kingston]], Jamaica is rocked by the [[Rodney Riots]], inspired by the barring of [[Walter Rodney]] from the country.
*  1968   &ndash; [[Yasunari Kawabata]] becomes the first Japanese person to be awarded the [[Nobel Prize in Literature]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; In response to the [[October Crisis]] terrorist kidnapping, [[Prime Minister]] [[Pierre Trudeau]] of Canada invokes the [[War Measures Act]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[Henry Kissinger]] and [[Le Duc Tho]] are awarded the [[Nobel Peace Prize]].
*[[1975]] &ndash; The [[Balibo Five]], a group of Australian [[television]] [[journalist]]s based in the town of [[Balibo]] in the then [[Portuguese Timor]] (now [[East Timor]]), are killed by [[Indonesia]]n troops.
*  1975   &ndash; [[Rahima Banu]], a two-year old girl from the village of Kuralia in [[Bangladesh]], is the last known person to be infected with naturally occurring [[smallpox]].
*  1975   &ndash; The Australian [[Coalition (Australia)|Coalition]] opposition parties using their senate majority, vote to defer the decision to grant supply of funds for the [[Gough Whitlam|Whitlam]] Government's annual budget, sparking the [[1975 Australian constitutional crisis]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; [[Karol Wojtyla]] is elected [[Pope John Paul II]] after the [[Papal conclave, October 1978|October 1978 Papal conclave]], the first non-Italian [[pontiff]] since [[1523]].
*  1978   &ndash; [[Wanda Rutkiewicz]] is the first Pole and the first European woman to reach the summit of [[Mount Everest]].
*[[1984]] &ndash; ''[[The Bill]]'' debuted on [[ITV (TV network)|ITV]], eventually becoming the longest-running [[police procedural]] in British television history.
*  1984   &ndash; [[Desmond Tutu]] is awarded the [[Nobel Peace Prize]].
*[[1986]] &ndash; [[Reinhold Messner]] becomes the first person to summit all 14 [[Eight-thousanders]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Luby's shooting]]: George Hennard runs amok in [[Killeen, Texas|Killeen]], [[Texas]], killing 23 and wounding 20 in Luby's Cafeteria.
*[[1993]] &ndash; Anti-Nazism riot breaks out in [[Welling]] in [[Kent]], after [[Metropolitan Police|police]] stop protesters approaching the [[British National Party]] headquarters.
*[[1995]] &ndash; The [[Million Man March]] occurs in [[Washington, D.C.]]
*  1995   &ndash; The [[Skye Bridge]] is opened.
*[[1996]] &ndash; 84 people are killed and more than 180 injured as 47,000 [[association football|football]] fans attempt to squeeze into the 36,000-seat ''[[Estadio Mateo Flores]]'' in [[Guatemala City]].
*[[1998]] &ndash; Former [[Chile]]an dictator General [[Augusto Pinochet]] is [[Augusto Pinochet's arrest and trial|arrested]] in London on a warrant from Spain requesting his [[extradition]] on murder charges.
*[[2002]] &ndash; [[Bibliotheca Alexandrina]] in the Egyptian city of [[Alexandria]], a commemoration of the [[Library of Alexandria]] that was lost in [[Classical antiquity|antiquity]], is officially inaugurated.
*[[2006]] &ndash; [[2006 Hawaii earthquake|Hawaii earthquake]]: A magnitude 6.7 earthquake rocks Hawaii, causing property damage, injuries, [[landslide]]s, [[power outage]]s, and the closure of [[Honolulu International Airport]].
*[[2012]] &ndash; The [[extrasolar planet]] [[Alpha Centauri Bb]] is discovered.
*[[2013]] &ndash; [[Lao Airlines Flight 301]] crashes on approach to [[Pakse International Airport]] in [[Laos]], killing 49 people.
